attributes.action: Institutional lenient sentencing of Female criminals must be abolished
attributes.additional_details:
Men serve longer in prison than Women for the same offence groups (in months):

Violence - 18.8 for Men, 12.7 for Women
Sexual offences - 30.3 for Men, 17.1 for Women
Possession of weapons - 15.1, 8.6

Men compared to Women in receipt immediate custodial sentences:

Violence - 44% to 21%
Theft - 29% to 17%
Fraud - 25% to 9%

For more see below

Source, extrapolated from Government statistics: http://www.conservativewoman.co.uk/wp-content/uploads/2016/09/Custody-and-Sentencing-Statistics-MoJ1.jpg
attributes.background:
When it comes to imprisonment, Women on average are sentenced to custody less & serve less time for the same offence groups and thus are punished less severely than men.

This is not equality, this is systematic discrimination of both sexes by  giving unequal treatment to Women than given to Men

rejection.details: Sentencing is a matter for the courts, which are independent of the UK Government and Parliament.
